snippet: The noble idea of limiting the Baseball Hall of Fame to the truly elite is a fantasy as the writers who vote for players continue to wrestle with the residue of the game’s steroids era.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column holds that the noble idea of limiting the Baseball Hall of Fame to the truly elite is a fantasy as the writers who vote for players continue to wrestle with the residue of the game’s steroids era; names 33 players over the next five ballots who belong in the Hall of Fame conversation.
lead_paragraph: The noble idea of limiting the Baseball Hall of Fame to the truly elite is a fantasy as the writers who vote for players continue to wrestle with the residue of the game’s steroids era.

headline.seo: At the Hall of Fame, Forgetting History and Perhaps Repeating It
headline.main: At the Hall, Forgetting History and Perhaps Repeating It
headline.print_headline: At the Hall, Forgetting History and Perhaps Repeating It
